CAPTION FIG1.png:
"

**Fig. 1. CCSs accumulate along collagen fibers.** (**A**) MDA-MB-231 cells were seeded in a 3D network of collagen fibers (red) and fused 24 hours later before being stained for a-adaptin (green). A single optical section is shown. Scale bar, 10 \(\mu\)m. (Insets) Higher magnifications of bound regions. Scale bars, 3 \(\mu\)m (**B**) Electron microscopy micrograph of a MDA-MB-231 cell in the 3D collagen network depicting a collagen fiber in the cleft of a CCS. Scale bar, 100 nm. (**C**) Kymograph showing CCS (green) dynamics and collagen fibers (red) in a genome-edited MDA-MB-231 cell expressing endogenous GFP-tagged \(\mu\)2-adaptin, imaged with spurring disk microscopy every 5 s for 5 min in the 3D collagen network. (**D**) Quantification of the lifetime of CCSs located on fibers or not, as indicated in genome-edited MDA-MB-231 cells in the 3D network (mean \(\pm\) SEM; \(\pi\)\(\geq\) 125 CCSs. *_P_ < 0.01, Student's \(t\) test). (**E**) MDA-MB-231 cells spreading on a thin layer of collagen fibers (red) polymerized on glass were fixed at the indicated time point and stained for a-adaptin (green). (**F**) Distribution of the average fluorescence intensity of a-adaptin staining per collagen fibers as a function of cell spread area. For linear regression, correlation coefficient (r) = 0.6475; \(P\) < 0.0001, ANOVA test. (**G**) Average fluorescence intensity of a-adaptin staining on collagen fibers 15 min after plating in control or hypotonic medium as indicated (mean \(\pm\) SEM; \(\pi\)\(=\) 3 experiments, *_P_ < 0.01, Student's \(t\) test).

"

**Fig. 2. Ultrachetural characterization of HCAL.** (A to Ii Survey view of the cyclostare surface of the plasma membrane in unrooted central [(A) to (O) and (G)] or CHC-depleted [(E) (F), (A), and (I)] MO4-MB-231 cells plated for 15 min on a thin layer of collagen fibre polymerized on glass. For (B) to (F), use view glass for 20 viewing of anayythe (left eye, red). In (E), (G), and (H), a-adaptin area intrunlabeled with gold particles (yellow dots). Arrows indicate collagen fiber. Pictures in (G) to (I) show area of the plasma membrane in contact with the flat, collagen-coated glass centrifuge and agent that eight-coated lattice (G) and characteristic patches at pretenacea muters [(H) and (I)] positive for a-adaptin (H) and thus corresponding to the coat of clathrin-adaptura. Scale bars, (A) 1 mm, (B) to (H) 500 nm, and (I) 200 nm.

CAPTION FIG3.png: 'Figure 3: **Membrane curvature and collagen control TCAL accumulation on fibers.** (**A**) Quantification of the lifetime of CCSs located on fibers or not, as indicated, in genome-edited NdA-MB-231 cells imaged for 10 min between 10 and 20 min after plating on a thin layer of collagen fibers polymerized on glass (mean ± SEM; n ≥ 125 CCSs, *P < 0.01, Student’s f test). (**B**) Kymograph of a genome-edited NdA-MB-231 cell that was plated on a thin layer of collagen (red) fibers and imaged with spinning disks microscopy every 5 s for 10 min between 10 and 20 min after plating. CCSs are marked with the endgeneous GFP-tagged μM2-adaptin (green). (**C**) Quantification of CCS nucleation rate index on collagen fibers or after shifting the position of collagen fibers by 5 pixels to the right (Offset) (mean ± SEM; n = 3 experiments, *P < 0.01, Student’s f test). (**D**) NdA-MB-231 cells spreading on 200-nm-diameter beads (red) spotted on glass were fixed 15 min after plating and stained for a-adaptin (green). A merge picture is shown. Scale bar, \\(\\overset{\\sim}{\\text{D}}\\) mm. (**E**) Quantification of the percentage of uncoated or collagen-coated beads found below cells and colocalizing with CCSs. Positions of beads were shifted by 5 pixels to the right in the offset condition (mean ± SEM; n = 3 experiments, *P < 0.01, Kruskal-Wallis Gene-way ANOVA). (**F**) Kymograph of a genome-edited MDA-MB-231 cell that was plated on 200-nm-diameter beads (red) spotted on a glass-bottom dish and imaged with spinning disk microscopy every 5 s for 20 min immediately after plating, CCSs are marked with the endgeneous GFP-tagged μM2-adaptin (green). (**G**) Quantification of the percentage of collagen-coated beads found below cells and colocalizing with CCSs. 15 min after spreading in isotopic or hypotonic media as indicated (mean ± SEM; n = 3 experiments, *P < 0.01, Student’s f test).\n\n'

Fig. 4: **TCALs regulate binding to collagen fibers.****(A)** MDA-MB-231 cells spreading on a layer of collagen fibers (left) were fixed and stained foractivated bilirubin (right) 15 min after plating. Scale bar, 10 μM. (**B** and **C**) Average fluorescence distribution along collagen fibers of bilirubin (integrin) or a-adaptin in (B) control or (C) Dahl2-depleted cells. Error bars indicate mean +- SEM. (**D**) Average fluorescence intensity of a-adaptin staining per collagen fibers measured 15 min after plating in control or Dabl2-depleted cells. (**F**) Calcein-loaded MDA-MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNAs were plated on collagen-coated 5-kPa acrylamide gel for 15 min before washing (mattracted cells. Cell-associated fluorescence was measured and expressed as a percentage at 5-M of control cells. (**G**) Quantification of collagen fibers movement measured during the first 15 min of spreading of MDA-MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNAs. For (D) to (G), data are expressed as mean +- SEM; \(n\) = 3 experiments, *_P_ < 0.01, Kruskal-Wallis, one-way ANOVA.

CAPTION FIG5.png:
'

**Fig. 5. TCALs regulate migration by stabilizing cell protrusions.** (**_A_**) Average velocity of MDA-MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNA and migrating in the 3D collagen network (mean +- SEM; \(n\) = 3 experiments, *_P_ < 0.05, **_P_ < 0.01, Kruskal-Wallis one-way ANOVA). (**_B_**) Average maximum elongation of all visible protrusions in MDA-MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNA and migrating in the 3D collagen network (mean +- SEM; \(n\) = 3 experiments, *_P_ < 0.01, Kruskal-Wallis one-way ANOVA). (**_C_**) The extremity of a MDA-MB-231 cell migrating in a 3D collagen network (top) was laser ablated. (Top middle and bottom middle) Collagen fibers corresponding to boxed area at top, 1 +- before and after laser ablation, as indicated. The dashed line shows where ablation was performed. (Bottom) The calculated displacement field based on collagen fiber pictures 1 +- before and after laser ablation, to illustrate collagen fiber movements upon relaxation. Color-coded bar of displacement intensity is shown. Scale bar, 10 +- (**_D_**) Representative galleries of protrusion retraction over 140 s after laser ablation of the extremity of MDA-MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNAs. Green arrows show the extremity of protrusions. Dashed lines show where laser ablation was performed. White arrows show the free extremity of retracting protrusions after ablation. Scale bar, 10 +- (**_E_**) Average distance of protrusion retraction over 3 min after laser ablation of their extremity in MDA-MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNA (mean +- SEM; \(n\) = 3 experiments, *_P_ < 0.01, Kruskal-Wallis one-way ANOVA).

CAPTION FIGS2.png: '\n\n**Fig. S2 Types of CCS accumulation on collagen fibers in 2D. A, HeLa cells were plated on a thin layer of collagen fibers (red) polymerized on glass for 15 min before being fixed and stained for \\(\\alpha\\)-adaptin (green). Scale bar: 10 \\(\\mu\\)m. B, MDA\\(\\cdot\\)MB-231 cells were plated for 15 min on the top of a thin layer of collagen fibers (blue) before being fixed and stained for \\(\\alpha\\)-adaptin (green) and vinculin (red). Scale bar: 10 \\(\\mu\\)m. C, MDA\\(\\cdot\\)MB-231 cells were plated for 15 min on the top of a thin layer of collagen fibers (blue) before being fixed and stained for \\(\\alpha\\)-adaptin (green) and cortactin (red). Arrowheads point to cortactin-positive linear invadopodia. Scale bar: 4 \\(\\mu\\)m. D, E, MDA\\(\\cdot\\)MB-231 cells treated with CHC (D) or Dynamin-2 (E) specific siRNA s were plated for 15 min on the top of a thin layer of collagen fibers (red) before being fixed and stained for \\(\\alpha\\)-adaptin (green). Scale bars: 10 \\(\\mu\\)m. F, Average fluorescence intensity of \\(\\alpha\\)-adaptin staining per collagen fibers 15 min after plating MDA\\(\\cdot\\)MB\\(\\cdot\\)231 cells treated with the indicated siRNA. G, Western blot analyses of CHC, dynamin-2 and talin expression upon depletion using indicated siRNAs. Tubulin was used as a loading control. H, MDA\\(\\cdot\\)MB-231 cells treated with talin specific siRNAs were plated for 60 min on the top of a thin layer of collagen fibers before being fixed and stained for \\(\\alpha\\)-adaptin. Scale bars: 10 \\(\\mu\\)m. I, Average fluorescence intensity of \\(\\alpha\\)-adaptin staining per collagen fibers at the indicated time after plating MDA\\(\\cdot\\)MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNA (* P<0.01).**'
CAPTION FIGS3-1.png: '\n\n**Fig. S3 Ultrastructural analysis of CCSs. A, B, MDA-MB-231 cells treated with control siRNA were plated for 15 min on the top of a thin layer of collagen fibers before being unroofed and processed for electron microscopy analysis. Red and white arrows point to collagen fibers outside or below the cell membrane, respectively. For insets, use view glasses for 3D viewing of anaglyphs (left eye = red). C, Western blot analyses of CHC'
CAPTION FIGS3-2.png: 'expression upon single or double rounds of siCHC transfection as indicated (see Materials and Methods section). Tubulin was used as a loading control. **D**, **E**, MDA-MB-231 cells treated twice with control siRNAs (D) or with CHC -specific siRNAs (E) were plated for 15 min on the top of a thin layer of collagen fibers before being unroofed and processed for electron microscopy analysis. Pictures show areas of the plasma membrane away from collagen fibers, in contact with the flat, collagen-coated glass coverslips and depict flat clathrin-coated lattice (D) and characteristic patches of proteinaceous material (E) corresponding to the coat of clathrin-adaptors without clathrin. Scale bars are indicated.\n\n'

CAPTION FIGS5.png:
'

**Fig. S5 Dab2 and \(\beta\)1-integrin localize to CCSs on fibers.****A**, MDA-MB-231 cells were plated for 15 min on the top of a thin layer of collagen fibers (blue) before being fixed and stained for \(\alpha\)-adaptin (green) and \(\beta\)1-integrin (red). Scale bars: 2 \(\mu\)m. **B**, MDA-MB-231 cells were plated for 15 min on planar collagen-coated glass bottom dish before being fixed and stained for \(\alpha\)-adaptin (red) and \(\beta\)1-integrin (green) and imaged by TIRF microscopy. Scale bars: 10 \(\mu\)m. **C**, MDA-MB-231 cells were plated for 15 min on the top of a thin layer of collagen fibers (blue) before being fixed and stained for \(\alpha\)-adaptin (green) and Dab2 (red). Scale bars: 5 \(\mu\)m.

'
CAPTION FIGS6.png:
'

**Fig. S6 Dab2 knockdown inhibits TCAL recruitment on collagen fibers in 2D. A, B, C, D,** Control (B) or MDA\(\cdot\)MB\(\cdot\)231 cells treated with control (A) or Dab2-specific (C, D) siRNA were plated for 15 min on the top of a thin layer of collagen fibers before being unroofed and processed for electron microscopy analysis. (A, B) Arrows point to collagen fibers and portion of collagen fibers outside the cell are highlighted in red. Higher magnification of boxed regions in A and B are shown. For B, D and insets in A and C, use view glasses for 3D viewing of anaglyphs (left eye = red). Scale bars are indicated.

CAPTION FIGS7.png:
'

**Fig. S7**

**Characterization of the role of CCSs in cell adhesion to collagen fibers.****A,** Calcein-loaded MDA-MB-231 cells incubated or not in the presence of the b1-integrin blocking antibody 4B4 were allowed to adhere to collagen-coated polystyrene plates for 15 min. Cell-associated fluorescence was measured and expressed as a percentage +- s.e.m. of untreated cells (* P<0.01). **B**, Western blot analyses of \(\alpha\)-adaptin, Dab2, Numb and ARH expression upon depletion using indicated siRNA s. Tubulin was used as a loading control. **C**, Calcein-loaded MDA-MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNA were allowed to adhere to collagen-coated polystyrene plates for 15 min. Cell-associated fluorescence was measured and expressed as a percentage +- s.e.m. of control cells. **D**, MDA-MB-231 cells were allowed to spread on collagen-coated glass coverslip (left panel) or 5kPa acrylamide gel (right panel) for 15 min before being fixed and stained for vinculin. Scale bar: 10 \(\mu\)m. **E**, Average fluorescence distribution along collagen fibers of b1-integrin and \(\alpha\)-adaptin in cells treated twice with CHC-specific siRNAs. Error bars indicate mean +- s.e.m. **F**, Calcein-loaded MDA-MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNA were allowed to adhere to collagen-coated polystyrene plates for 15 min. Cell-associated fluorescence was measured and expressed as a percentage +- s.e.m. of control cells (* P<0.01). **G**, Representative color-coded time-resolved imaged of the movement of collagen fibers during MDA-MB-231 cells spreading. Scale bar: 10 \(\mu\)m. **H**, Quantification of collagen fibers movement measured during the first 15 min of spreading of MDA-MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNAs. **I**, Quantification of collagen fibers movement measured during the first 15 min of spreading of MDA-MB-231 cells stably expressing GFP or GFP-tagged mouse Dab2 constructs and treated or not with Dab2-specific siRNA as indicated (* P<0.01). **J**, MDA-MB-231 cells stably expressing mouse GFP-tagged wild type or PTB domain-less Dab2 (\(\Delta\)PTB) constructs as indicated and treated with Dab2-specific siRNAs were imaged by spinning disk microscopy. Scale bar: 10 \(\mu\)m.

'

**Fig. S8 Characterization of cell protrusion dynamics in the 3D environment.** A, Average number \(\pm\) s.e.m of total protrusions emitted per cell and per hour in cells treated with the indicated siRNA and migrating in the 3D collagen network. **B,** Average maximum elongation of leading protrusions \(\pm\) s.e.m in MDA-MB-231 cells treated with the indicated siRNA and migrating in the 3D collagen network (* P\(\ll\)0.01). **C**, Maximum z-projection of a stack of 21 pictures of MDA-MB-231 cells expressing Paxillin-GFP and migrating in a 3D network of collagen fibers. Inset shows merge picture of green (Paxillin-GFP) and red (collagen fibers) channels. Scale bar: 10 \(\mu\)m.
